N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.146 - Executive order no. 146: establishing the position of state director of housing

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York faces a critical shortage of
decent affordable housing that threatens New York's economic future and the
well being of its citizens; WHEREAS, the coordinated efforts of the State's housing
agencies would ensure that resources are fully maximized and appropriately
allocated and that the State' s essential housing needs are met; and
WHEREAS, to ensure such coordination, one person designated
by the Governor should assume primary responsibility and accountability for the

State's housing system. NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish the position of Director of

Housing. I. Powers and

Responsibilities

The Director of Housing shall advise and assist the

Governor in the development and implementation of comprehensive policies and
programs to promote and support the development, preservation and
rehabilitation of decent affordable housing. In meeting this objective, the

Director shall oversee the Office of the Director of Housing and shall have the
following responsibilities: (1)
create
a strong, centralized administrative structure to coordinate the policies and
programs of the Division of Housing and Community Renewal, the New York State

Housing Finance Agency, the State of New York Mortgage Agency, the New York

State Mortgage Loan Enforcement & Administration Corporation, the New York

State Project Finance Agency, Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation and other

State agencies and public corporations involved in housing; (2)
identify specific program initiatives and
methods to combine the resources of government and the public and private
sectors in order to increase the production of affordable housing; (3)
serve as Chair of the Housing Subcabinet
and hold the responsibility for identifying, examining, and resolving
interagency issues; (4)
advise the

Governor concerning federal policies and actions and serve as Chair of the New

York State Task Force on the National Affordable Housing Act and develop the

State's Comprehensive Housing Assistance Strategy (CHAS) and annual updates
thereafter in accordance with the Act to establish eligibility for federal
funds; (5)
oversee the supervision, direction and management of the State's housing programs and projects to assure
their timely implementation and operation; (6)
establish and coordinate the legislative
agenda, budgetary requests, and annual and interim reports of the State's
housing agencies to the Governor and Legislature; (7)
coordinate programmatic and fiscal
initiatives for the State's housing agencies; (8)
work with the Legislature, the Division
of the Budget, and the State Comptroller to develop comprehensive approaches
for funding the State's housing programs; (9)
consolidate asset management functions
performed for the State's portfolio of assisted housing projects, consolidate
the State's housing development activities and consolidate the State's finance
authorities; and
(10)
assume
primary responsibility for the coordination of housing information systems in

New York State. II. Personnel and Resources

The State Director of Housing shall be authorized to use
existing staff and resources of State agencies, departments, divisions, and
offices of the State which are hereby directed to render full cooperation and
assistance as the Director shall require for the effective discharge of his or
her responsibilities. III. Executive Order 67 dated June 5, 1985 is revoked and superseded by this

Executive Order. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: July 1, 1991
